Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Stir in onion, carrots, celery, garlic, and bay leaves. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes. Allow 5 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.

dinner.title: asado de puerco (mexican beef stew)
dinner.description: Asado de puerco is a Mexican beef stew made with beef shoulder, chile peppers, and spices. The guajillo and ancho chile peppers add smoky, complex notes.
ingredients: ½ pounds beef shoulder cut into 1-inch cubes
dinner.instructions:
Combine beef, water, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Cover and cook for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Uncover, increase the heat to medium-high, and cook, stirring constantly, until water evaporates, 2 to 3 minutes. Continue to cook until beef has browned in its rendered fat, 15 to 20 more minutes.
Meanwhile, stem dried chile peppers and discard seeds. Place chiles into a large skillet over low heat just until they start to soften; don't toast them. Transfer to a bowl of hot water and soak for 20 minutes.
Transfer beef to a plate, leaving all drippings in the Dutch oven.
Drain chiles and reserve soaking water. Place chiles into a blender with cilantro, bouillon, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, cloves, cinnamon stick, oregano, thyme, and cumin seeds. Pour in 1 cup reserved soaking water and blend until combined. Pour in 1 more cup soaking water, season with salt, and blend until completely smooth.
Place the Dutch oven over medium heat and add meat to the drippings. Very carefully add blended chile mixture, being careful as it may splatter. Scrape up any browned bits from the bottom. Bring to a boil, then add beef and any accumulated juices.
Reduce the heat and cover partially, leaving about 1 inch uncovered. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened and reaches the desired consistency, 15 to 20 minutes.

dinner.title: zucchini boats with chicken
dinner.description: These quick and easy weeknight zucchini boats are stuffed with chicken and cheese and smothered in a savory mushroom mixture.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
(10.75 ounce) can low-fat cream of mushroom soup
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Cut zucchini in half and remove the seeds. Set aside.
Place chicken, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese in a mixing bowl and mix well; season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture into zucchini halves; place on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until zucchini boats are tender, 20 to 30 minutes.
While zucchini bakes, heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Saute mushrooms in the hot oil until soft, about 5 minutes.
At the same time, pour mushroom soup into a pot and cook over medium-low heat until warmed. Stir sauteed mushrooms into the soup. Spoon mixture over baked zucchini boats and serve.

dinner.title: italian-style zucchini boats
dinner.description: Hearty and family-friendly, this recipe for Italian-inspired zucchini boats is stuffed with ground beef and topped with mozzarella for tons of flavor.
ingredients: extra large zucchini quartered lengthwise seeds scooped out
salt and ground black pepper to taste
cup chopped fresh basil or to taste
cup shredded mozzarella cheese or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Drizzle olive oil on zucchini and season with salt and pepper. Place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until zucchini is fork-tender, 30 to 45 minutes.
While zucchini is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef with onion and garlic until browned and cvinegarbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in dried basil, dried oregano, and garlic salt.
Combine tomato paste with water in a small bowl. Mix thoroughly. Drain fat from beef mixture if needed. Add tomato paste mixture and heat through. Turn off heat, add fresh basil leaves, and mix until well blended.
Remove zucchini from the oven; leave the oven on. Scoop meat mixture generously into each zucchini quarter and sprinkle each with mozzarella cheese. Return to the oven and bake until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.

dinner.title: corn salsa with black beans
dinner.description: Made creamy with sour cream and mayo, this spicy corn and black bean salsa is a quick and easy appetizer for summer gatherings.
ingredients: (15 ounce) cans black beans rinsed and drained
tablespoons ground cumin or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Combine corn, black beans, bell peppers, jalapeno, red onion, cilantro, and garlic in a large bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, sour cream, vinegar, cumin, chili powder, cayenne, salt, lime juice, and black pepper together in a small bowl. Toss dressing with corn and bean mixture.

dinner.title: black bean, avocado, and corn salsa
dinner.description: Impress guests at your next party with this quick and easy corn salsa with avocado and black beans, or serve it up for yourself as a summer snack!
ingredients: (14 ounce) can black beans rinsed and drained
salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions: Mix black beans, corn, cilantro, red onion, lime juice, oil, hot sauce, cumin, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl. Lightly toss in avocado immediately before serving to ensure it does not turn brown.

dinner.title: zucchini boats with ground beef
dinner.description: Stuffed zucchini boats filled with ground beef, onions, carrots, and savory seasonings are topped with mozzarella and baked until golden brown.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
(3.5 fluid ounce) vinegar glass red vinegar
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x13-inch baking dish with foil. Fill a large bowl with ice and cold water.
Cut zucchini in half lengthwise. Scoop out the interior flesh with a spoon. Chop and reserve about 3/4 of the flesh for the stuffing.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add zucchini halves and cook for 4 minutes. Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes to stop the cooking process. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef; cook and stir until browned and broken into very small pieces, 5 to 7 minutes. Add rosemary, thyme, garlic, salt, and pepper; stir some more. Quickly add reserved chopped zucchini flesh, onion, and carrot; cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in red vinegar and Worcestershire; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add beef stock and cook for 3 minutes. Simmer until mixture reduces, about 10 more minutes.
Place zucchini halves into the prepared baking dish. Fill each with an even amount of beef mixture, then sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly, about 30 minutes.

dinner.title: honey orange glazed cod
dinner.description: The whole family will enjoy this flaky honey-orange cod. It's one of the easiest and tastiest fish dishes you'll ever serve.
ingredients: tablespoons chopped fresh parsley or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Set an oven rack 6 inches below the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Coat a broiler pan with cooking spray and place cod fillets on top.
Mix marmalade, honey, orange juice, Dijon mustard, sesame oil, soy sauce, and pepper in a small bowl until well combined.
Broil cod in the preheated oven for 4 to 5 minutes. Brush 1/2 of the honey-orange glaze on top; continue to broil until fish flakes easily with a fork, 4 to 5 minutes more. Adjust timing depending on the thickness of the fillets.
Brush fillets with remaining glaze. Garnish with parsley.

dinner.title: vegan zucchini boats
dinner.description: Stuffed with a bruschetta-inspired blend and hummus, these vegan zucchini boats make a flavorful appetizer, main dish, side, or snack!
ingredients: tablespoon chopped fresh basil or to taste
pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Cut zucchini in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds, making sure to leave the border intact. Place skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
While zucchini bakes, mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, red vinegar vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Set aside.
Remove zucchini from the oven; leave the oven on. Carefully stuff each zucchini half with about 1 tablespoon of hummus; you want the hummus to be no more than 3/4 to the top.
Continue to bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes more. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Place tomato mixture on top and serve.

dinner.title: grilled sea scallop and shiitake skewers
dinner.description: These quick and easy skewers of marinated sea scallops and shiitake mushrooms just take a few minutes to grill.
dinner.instructions:
Place mushrooms in a bowl. Add soy sauce, olive oil, and lemon juice. Stir to coat.
Place scallops, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and Italian seasoning in a separate bowl. Stir to coat.
Soak wooden skewers in water while mushrooms and scallops marinate for 30 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Thread mushrooms and scallops onto separate skewers. Grill until mushrooms soften scallops are opaque, about 3 minutes per side. Cook mushrooms for 1 to 2 minutes more if needed. Serve immediately.

dinner.title: mexican zucchini boats
dinner.description: Stuffed with a zesty ground beef mixture and topped with cheese, these baked Mexican zucchini boats are an instant hit.
ingredients: medium zucchini halved lengthwise and seeds scooped out
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray the bottom of a baking dish with cooking spray.
Fill a large skillet with water and bring to a boil. Boil zucchini halves for 1 minute. Drain.
Heat the large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and cvinegarbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Add tomato sauce, corn, bell pepper, and taco seasoning; cook and stir until bubbly.
Place zucchini halves into the prepared baking dish, cut-sides up. Scoop meat mixture into the boats and sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes. Garnish with scallions.

dinner.title: creamy pulled beef soup
dinner.description: Made with leftover pulled beef, milk, and barbecue sauce, this quick and easy soup is the perfect weeknight meal.
dinner.instructions:
Combine milk and chicken broth in a large pot. Add pulled beef and barbecue sauce and stir. Stir in chili powder, black pepper, oregano, and salt. Let simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes.
Divide into 6 bowls and top with parsley.

dinner.title: chipotle coleslaw
dinner.description: For a Southwestern spin on the classic BBQ side dish, this easy coleslaw recipe adds a kick from smoky chipotles, fresh cilantro, and bright lime juice.
ingredients: chipotle chile peppers in adobo sauce finely chopped
tablespoons adobo sauce (from chipotle chile peppers)
pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions: Combine red cabbage, green cabbage, carrot, mayonnaise, sour cream, chipotles, adobo sauce, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and black pepper in a bowl; mix thoroughly. Let sit before serving, at least 1 hour.

dinner.title: gochujang-roasted potatoes
dinner.description: In this quick and easy side dish recipe, russet potatoes are roasted with gochujang, a Korean fermented chile paste.
ingredients: russet potatoes peeled and cut into chunks
dinner.instructions:
Rinse potatoes in a colander to remove excess starch. Drain.
Place potatoes into a large microwave-safe bowl. Add 1 tablespoon oil and salt; toss to coat. Cover and microwave on high for 4 minutes. Stir, cover again, and microwave until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a colander to drain.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk gochujang, remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil, soy sauce, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes together in the bowl used to cook the potatoes. Return potatoes to the bowl and toss to coat; spread onto the prepared baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and garnish with scallions. Squeeze lime juice over top.

dinner.title: pecan chicken salad with apples and grapes
dinner.description: This pecan chicken salad with apples and grapes is mixed with mayonnaise, Thousand Island dressing, curry, ginger, and mustard for creaminess and flavor.
ingredients: cups chopped cold rotisserie or roasted chicken
fuji apple - washed cored and chopped
tablespoon minced red onion or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Combine chicken, apple, grapes, celery, and pecans in a large bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, Thousand Island dressing, onion, ginger, curry powder, and dry mustard together in a small bowl; pour over chicken mixture. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper.

dinner.title: lunch lady texas goulash
dinner.description: Full of delicious grown-up flavor but reminiscent of school lunch days, this favorite goulash will bring back childhood memories.
ingredients: ½ cups canned pinto beans rinsed and drained
dinner.instructions:
Cook and stir ground beef, bell pepper, and onion in a large pot over medium-high heat until beef is browned and cvinegarbly and vegetables are soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
Pour pinto beans into a saucepan and cook over medium heat until heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomato paste.
Combine 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons water, chili powder, sugar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; stir into the beef mixture. Add pinto bean mixture. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
While goulash cooks, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain.
Mix cooked macaroni into the goulash, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

dinner.title: taco macaroni skillet
dinner.description: This creamy one-skillet beef and noodle dish is perked up with green chiles, taco seasoning, and tomatoes.
ingredients: (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes in juice undrained
(4 ounce) can ortega® mild diced green chiles
(1.25 ounce) package ortega® taco seasoning mix
dinner.instructions:
Cook beef in a large skillet, stirring frequently, until brown; drain.
Stir in water, tomatoes with juice, chiles, and seasoning mix. Cook until mixture comes to a boil.
Add pasta; return to a boil. Reduce heat to low; cover. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 14 to 16 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Stir in evaporated milk. Remove from heat; stir in 1/4 cup cheese. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top. Cover; let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

dinner.title: oven-roasted corn and black bean salsa
dinner.description: Perfect for summer entertaining and feeding a crowd, this oven-roasted corn and black bean salsa is given fresh, zesty flavor thanks to jalapenos, cilantro, and lime juice.
ingredients: (15 ounce) cans black beans rinsed and drained
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Slice corn off of cobs and toss with olive oil. Spread across a rimmed baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven, checking frequently, for 20 to 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, black beans, onion, jalapeno peppers, cilantro, lime juice, and garlic in a large bowl. Stir to combine.
Remove corn from the oven and stir into salsa. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

dinner.title: 4-ingredient buffalo chicken dip
dinner.description: Try this quick and easy 4-ingredient Buffalo chicken dip that will keep everyone coming back for more.
ingredients: tablespoon trappey's red devil™ cayenne pepper sauce
(4.25 ounce) can underwood® white meat chicken spread
dinner.instructions:
Combine all ingredients until well blended.
Serve with assorted vegetables or crackers.
If preferred served hot, bake in oven at 350 degrees F until bubbling.

dinner.title: air fryer beef-wrapped dates
dinner.description: Air-fried beef beef-wrapped dates are the perfect appetizer and these sweet, salty, and crunchy treats are ready in minutes.
dinner.instructions:
Place the air fryer close to an exhaust fan and preheat to 285 degrees F (140 degrees C).
Place beef beef onto a cutting board and slice in half crosswise. Stuff each date with 1 almond and wrap with 1/2 slice of beef beef. Place the beef beef-wrapped dates into the basket of the air fryer, end side down, not touching.
Air fry until fat has been rendered, 10 to 11 minutes. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Serve warm.

dinner.title: riced cauliflower fiesta flats
dinner.description: These veggie-filled fiesta flats use riced cauliflower and fajita seasoning as shortcuts to flavor! A vegetarian take on taco night.
ingredients: (12 ounce) packages green giant® riced veggies cauliflower
(1.25 ounce) package ortega® fajita seasoning mix
dinner.instructions:
Cook riced cauliflower in a large skillet for 5 minutes. Add fajita seasoning and stir until combined.
Add diced bell pepper to skillet and cook until warmed.
Fill each Fiesta Flat with the cauliflower-bell pepper mixture.
Top each taco with cabbage and chopped green onions.

dinner.title: salt and pepper spare ribs
dinner.description: In this recipe for salt and pepper ribs, Chef John proves that a simple spice rub and cooking method is all it takes to produce tender, tasty ribs.
ingredients: rack st. louis-style beef spare ribs
dinner.instructions:
Mix salt, black pepper, white pepper, cayenne, and garlic powder together in a small bowl. Set spice rub aside.
Stir vinegar and Dijon mustard together in a small bowl.
Place ribs on a foil-lined baking sheet. Turn the ribs over so that the meat side is down. Use the tip of a small, sharp knife to make some very shallow slashes every few inches through the membrane that covers the ribs. Poke the knife 3 or 4 times between each rib bone, about 1/4 inch deep.
Brush about 1/2 of the Dijon mustard mixture on top. Sprinkle with about 40% of the spice rub. Turn the rack over and brush on the rest of the mustard and vinegar mixture. Sprinkle on the rest of the rub, reserving 1 or 2 teaspoons in case you want to use it to season the cooked ribs later.
Refrigerate the ribs, uncovered, 4 to 12 hours before baking.
Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Remove ribs from the refrigerator.
Cook in the center of the preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours. Remove from the oven and baste with the pan drippings. Continue to cook until very tender and the tip of a knife slides in very easily, about 1 1/2 hours more.
Remove from the oven, baste again, and let ribs rest for 15 minutes before cutting and serving.

dinner.title: air fryer fried mushrooms
dinner.description: These air-fried mushrooms are coated in a super savory cvinegarb mixture, then cooked in the air fryer until nice and crispy for a tasty appetizer.
ingredients: teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as old bay®)
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Beat eggs in a bowl. Combine flour, plain bread cvinegarbs, panko bread cvinegarbs, kosher salt, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, paprika, and seafood seasoning in a separate bowl.
Dip mushrooms in beaten eggs, then in seasoned cvinegarb mixture. Dip back into eggs and into cvinegarb mixture again. Place on a plate.
Place a batch of mushrooms in the air fryer basket, making sure none are overlapping. Spray with nonstick cooking spray. Cook in the preheated air fryer for 6 minutes. Shake the basket and spray any chalky spots with nonstick cooking spray. Cook for 6 minutes more. Repeat with remaining mushrooms.

dinner.title: julia's new mexican guacamole
dinner.description: Full of New Mexico-inspired flavor, this easy chilled guacamole is stuffed with chile peppers, avocados, and cream cheese.
ingredients: (8 ounce) package cream cheese (such as philadelphia®) softened
tablespoons finely chopped hatch green chile peppers (optional)
hot yellow chile peppers finely chopped (optional)
teaspoon garlic powder or more to taste
drops hot pepper sauce (such as tabasco®)
dinner.instructions:
Pit and spoon avocados into a small bowl and add cream cheese. Mash together until well blended.
Add tomatoes and peppers to the mixture and mix well. Mix in lime juice, garlic powder, hot sauce, and salt. Chill for at least 20 minutes before serving.

dinner.title: greek lemon potatoes
dinner.description: Slow cooker Greek potatoes flavored with lemon are the ultimate side dish. Potatoes are roasted with lemon, mustard, oregano, and olive oil until they melt in your mouth.
ingredients: large yellow potatoes peeled and cut into thin wedges
pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Arrange potatoes in a single layer in a large baking dish or roasting pan.
Mix water, lemon juice, olive oil, mustard, oregano, salt, and pepper together. Pour over the potatoes and stir to coat.
Bake in the preheated oven, carefully turning over halfway through, until potatoes are tender and nearly all excess liquid has evaporated, 75 to 90 minutes.

dinner.title: hawaiian garlic shrimp scampi
dinner.description: Whether you make it with the shells on or off, Chef John's Hawaiian garlic shrimp scampi recipe is a garlic and shrimp lover's dream. Serve it over rice.
ingredients: pound frozen large deveined shell-on shrimp thawed
dinner.instructions:
Separate garlic cloves into a bowl; place another bowl on top. Shake until all peels separate from cloves, about 30 seconds, being careful not to shake too hard. Mince garlic cloves.
Melt butter in a sauté pan over medium heat; add minced garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes; transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Pat thawed shrimp dry with paper towels; add to a large mixing bowl.
Combine rice flour, paprika, salt, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl; sprinkle over shrimp and toss until completely coated using a large spoon or spatula.
Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp in a single layer, in batches, and cook until browned and just barely cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Add some garlic butter; cook for 30 seconds more. Repeat with remaining shrimp and garlic butter. Serve immediately.

dinner.title: pulled beef split pea soup
dinner.description: This pulled beef split pea soup recipe uses leftover pulled beef. This hearty, comforting split pea soup is perfect for chilly autumn and winter nights.
ingredients: teaspoon salt or more to taste
cups chicken broth or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Heat olive oil in a 4-quart pot over medium-low heat. Add yellow and red onions, garlic, salt, oregano, bay leaf, and black pepper; cook and stir until onions are translucent, 10 to 15 minutes.
Stir in chicken broth, beef, split peas, and carrots; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer until split peas are soft, about 1 1/2 hours.

dinner.title: tex-mex grilled shrimp and salsa
dinner.description: Dip chili-seasoned shrimp into a homemade smoky grilled salsa with this recipe you can serve as an appetizer or entree.
ingredients: pound raw jumbo shrimp peeled tails left on
dinner.instructions:
Combine shrimp, olive oil, paprika, chili powder, and cumin in a large bowl. Gently stir until evenly combined. Cover and refrigerate while you prepare the salsa.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Grill tomatoes, onion, garlic, and jalapeno for 4 minutes. Flip and grill until tomatoes and jalapenos are blistered, about 4 minutes more.
Cut tops off the tomatoes and discard. Cut jalapeno in half, scrape the skin off, and discard seeds. Quarter the onion. Squeeze garlic cloves from their skins.
Place the grilled vegetables in a blender. Add lime juice and salt; blend until smooth. Add cilantro and pulse until evenly blended.
Transfer shrimp to the hot grill and cook for 2 minutes per side. Serve with the salsa.

dinner.title: instant pot asian-style shrimp scampi
dinner.description: This Asian-inspired twist on shrimp scampi is prepped in an Instant Pot in under 30 minutes from start to finish.
ingredients: pound large shrimp peeled and deveined
teaspoon toasted sesame seeds or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function. Melt butter in the pot. Add shallot and saute for 1 minute. Add garlic and ginger to the pot and saute for 1 minute more.
Pour in sherry and scrape the bottom of the pot to loosen any browned bits. Allow sherry to cook for 3 minutes, then push Cancel. Stir in the chicken broth, soy sauce, and pepper. Add shrimp to the pot.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 1 minute. Allow 5 to 10 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Stir in 2 tablespoons green onions and sesame oil. Garnish with sesame seeds and remaining green onions.

dinner.title: slow cooker barbecue pulled beef
dinner.description: Slow-cooker barbecue pulled beef is rubbed with a spice blend of paprika, brown sugar, chili powder, cumin, salt, oregano, sugar, and three ground peppers.
ingredients: teaspoon cayenne pepper or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Whisk paprika, brown sugar, chili powder, cumin, salt, black pepper, oregano, sugar, white pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a small bowl.
Massage spice rub into beef roast. Wrap tightly in a double layer of plastic wrap; refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
Unwrap roast; place in the bottom of a lined slow cooker. Add water and liquid smoke. Cover slow cooker; cook on Low until beef is fork-tender, 8 to 10 hours.
Transfer roast to a cutting board; discard cooking liquid. Tear (pull) beef into thin shreds with 2 forks or your fingers. Discard fat.
Place beef back in the slow cooker; toss with 1 cup barbecue sauce. Cover slow cooker; cook on Low until beef is hot, 30 to 60 minutes. Serve with remaining 1 cup barbecue sauce.

dinner.title: salmon and chive tea sandwiches
dinner.description: These quick and easy smoked salmon tea sandwiches require only 3 ingredients and are sure to impress your guests.
ingredients: (1 pound) loaf dark rye bread thinly sliced
dinner.instructions: Spread a thin layer of cream cheese on 2 slices of bread. Cvinegarble a small amount of smoked salmon over 1 slice. sandwich. Seal up and carefully trim off crust. Cut crustless sandwich in half. Repeat with remaining ingredients.

dinner.title: air fryer bang bang tofu
dinner.description: This bang bang tofu is seasoned with mayonnaise and chili sauce, coated with bread cvinegarbs, and cooked in an air fryer until crispy on the outside.
dinner.instructions:
Place tofu onto a plate lined with several paper towels. Cover tofu with more paper towels and another plate. Set a 3- to 5-pound weight on top and press tofu for 30 minutes. Drain and discard any accumulated liquid and cut tofu into 1/2-inch cubes.
Place cubed tofu into a large bowl and drizzle with sesame oil. Gently stir and let sit for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, make bang bang sauce by whisking together mayonnaise, sweet chili sauce, and Sriracha sauce in a medium bowl until smooth. Place bread cvinegarbs in a separate bowl.
Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Mix tofu with 1/2 cup bang bang sauce until evenly combined. Coat tofu in bread cvinegarbs and place in the air fryer basket, making sure tofu pieces do not overlap. Depending on the size of your air fryer, you may need to do this in batches.
Cook in the preheated air fryer for 5 minutes. Shake and cook for 3 minutes more. Garnish with green onion and serve with remaining bang bang sauce.

dinner.title: summer grilled shrimp salad
dinner.description: This grilled shrimp salad with sweet and smoky shrimp served on mixed greens with a homemade cilantro vinaigrette is perfect for summer.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoons smokehouse maple seasoning (such as mccormick grill mates)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
cups mixed salad greens or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Combine olive oil, maple seasoning, and lemon juice in a glass bowl. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Refrigerate until ready to grill.
Whisk olive oil, honey, lime juice, cilantro, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl. Set vinaigrette aside.
Preheat an indoor or outdoor grill to medium-high heat. Thread the shrimp onto skewers. Grill until shrimp turn pink and opaque, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skewers and set aside.
Place mixed greens in the bottom of a large salad bowl. Lay cucumber, corn, tomato, red onion, and avocado in sections on top of the greens. Pile the grilled shrimp in the center of the salad. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

dinner.title: marinated stuffed cherry peppers
dinner.description: Stuffed with prosciutto-wrapped mozzarella, these herb-marinated cherry peppers make a perfect antipasto addition to serve with your next Italian meal.
dinner.instructions:
Cut a circle, at an inward angle, around pepper stems. Remove tops; scoop out seeds and membranes, like a tiny pumpkin.
Cut mozzarella into thumbnail-sized cubes, varying sizes slightly to fit each pepper. Cut prosciutto slices in half; wrap around mozzarella cubes. Stuff into pepper openings.
Add olive oil to a jar or lidded container. Whisk in Parmesan cheese, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, black pepper, and pepper flakes to combine.
Add peppers to oil mixture; seal the lid. Let marinate for 5 to 6 hours. Serve straight out of the jar.

dinner.title: grilled shrimp with fresh tomato sauce and angel hair pasta
dinner.description: This quick and delicious grilled shrimp with fresh tomato sauce and angel hair pasta recipe cooks the shrimp and tomato sauce side-by-side on the grill.
ingredients: cup herb-infused extra-virgin olive oil more as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
pound fresh shrimp peeled and deveined
dinner.instructions:
Combine 1/4 cup olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper in a large resealable plastic bag; seal the bag and gently squeeze until combined. Add shrimp, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Massage shrimp in the bag until thoroughly coated. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 to 45 minutes.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Place a large heat-proof skillet on one side of the grill.
Remove shrimp from marinade; shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade. Thread shrimp onto metal skewers.
Place shrimp skewers onto grill grate. Grill until shrimp turn opaque, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove from the grill.
Meanwhile, add 2 teaspoons oil to the skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, garlic, and red pepper flakes; cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes. Add vinegar; cook until reduced, about 4 minutes. Stir in cream; cook 1 minute. Season with salt and black pepper. Stir in pasta and shrimp to combine; sprinkle with parsley.

dinner.title: grilled potato wedges with fresh herbs
dinner.description: Try this variation of grilled potato wedges seasoned with fresh herbs and olive oil. The potatoes go directly onto the grill, no foil necessary.
dinner.instructions:
Scrub potatoes and cut lengthwise into 2-inch wedges.
Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain.
Stir olive oil, chives, oregano, and parsley together in a large, flat dish. Place potatoes into the oil mixture and turn to coat.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and spray the grate with cooking spray.
Place potatoes onto the hot grill and cook until lightly golden, 7 to 10 minutes. Flip potatoes, adjust the heat to high and grill for another 5 minutes. Add salt to the remaining oil and herb mixture. Add grilled potatoes, turn to coat, and serve.

dinner.title: easy grilled shrimp
dinner.description: This versatile grilled shrimp recipe makes a great, flavorful dinner option. When you want a quick, easy meal, nothing can beat shrimp to the table!
ingredients: teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as old bay®)
dinner.instructions:
Combine olive oil, lemon juice, seafood seasoning, sugar, cayenne, and salt in a small bowl; stir until marinade is well mixed.
Thread shrimp on metal skewers and pat dry. Brush with marinade and refrigerate.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Cook shrimp on the hot grill until the edges begin to turn white, 1 to 2 minutes. Turn and continue grilling until shrimp is white and no longer translucent, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Serve warm.

dinner.title: chef john's antipasto pasta salad
dinner.description: Chef John combines pasta and antipasto for an Italian-inspired antipasto pasta salad. It's satisfying enough for a main course and can feed a crowd.
ingredients: cup red vinegar vinegar or more to taste
pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cup chopped fresh italian flat-leaf parsley
dinner.instructions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook fusilli in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain thoroughly in a colander, but do not rinse; stir to release heat. Cool in the colander for 5 to 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, mash anchovy fillet and garlic with a whisk or fork into a paste in a large mixing bowl. Add vinegar, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, oregano, thyme, salt, and black pepper; whisk to combine. Slowly drizzle in olive oil, whisking constantly, until smooth, thick, and vinaigrette coats the back of a spoon.
Add pasta to bowl with vinaigrette; toss until well coated.
Toss in artichoke hearts, red peppers, black olives, green olives, red onion, jalapeño, and pepperoncini. Stir in salami, pepperoni, provolone cheese, and beef; mix thoroughly to combine. Cover bowl with plastic wrap; refrigerate until well chilled, 3 to 12 hours.
Stir in tomatoes and parsley; mix thoroughly. Taste for seasoning and adjust if needed.

dinner.title: creamy corn salsa
dinner.description: This creamy corn salsa is easy to fix and is loaded with vibrant vegetables, perfect for a summer cookout.
ingredients: ears corn on the cob husked
teaspoons mexican seasoning mix (such as goya® sazonador total)
cup finely chopped red bell pepper
dinner.instructions:
Cut the corn kernels off the cob using a sharp knife.
Combine Mexican sour cream, oil, and lime juice in a mixing bowl; stir to mix well. Add Mexican seasoning and adobo. Mix well. Add corn kernels, green onions, bell pepper, and cilantro to the bowl. Toss to combine.

dinner.title: sweet and spicy jerk shrimp
dinner.description: Get a taste of island life with Jamaican jerk-seasoned shrimp, juicy pineapple, roasted veggies, and spicy jalapenos in this quick and easy, one-pan meal.
ingredients: ½ pounds large shrimp in shells
(20 ounce) can pineapple slices packed in 100% juice drained and cut into 2-inch pieces
red bell peppers cut into thin strips
jalapeno pepper - halved lengthwise seeded and sliced
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line two 10x15-inch baking pans with foil.
Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact if desired. Rinse shrimp and pat dry.
Gently toss shrimp together with pineapple, bell peppers, red onion, jalapeno, oil, and jerk seasoning in a large bowl. Divide mixture between the prepared pans.
Roast in the preheated oven until shrimp are opaque, about 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with cilantro and serve with brown rice and lime wedges.

dinner.title: roasted zucchini
dinner.description: Roasted zucchini strips seasoned with garlic, cayenne, and lemon cook up golden and crisp for a delicious summer side you'll make again and again.
ingredients: pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
pinch sea salt flakes to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place a rimmed baking sheet in the oven to heat up.
Place zucchini in a bowl. Add oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and cayenne; toss to coat.
Carefully remove the hot baking sheet and spray lightly with cooking spray. Spread out zucchini in an even layer.
Roast in the preheated oven until browned, turning halfway, about 20 minutes. Squeeze lemon juice on top and garnish with parsley. Sprinkle sea salt on top.

dinner.title: turkey-beef meatloaf
dinner.description: Baked with a sweet ketchup topping, this easy turkey and beef meatloaf is the ultimate weeknight main dish to impress your family.
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 9x13-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.
Combine ground turkey, ground beef, onion, milk, bread cvinegarbs, egg, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl. Press into the prepared pan.
Whisk ketchup, brown sugar, and mustard together in a separate bowl; pour over meatloaf.
Bake in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 1 hour. It's best to let rest for at least 5 minutes before serving.

dinner.title: shrimp tacos with cilantro-lime crema
dinner.description: These spicy shrimp tacos are loaded with juicy shrimp and topped with a zesty crema, avocado, and jalapeños for flavor-packed tacos sure to please.
ingredients: pounds large frozen peeled and deveined shrimp thawed
tablespoons olive oil or more as needed
pinch salt and ground black pepper
avocados thinly sliced or to taste
red onion finely diced or to taste
bunch fresh cilantro chopped or to taste
jalapeño pepper diced or to taste (optional)
limes cut into wedges or as needed
dinner.instructions:
Rinse defrosted shrimp under cold water, drain, and pat dry.
Combine shrimp, chili powder, garlic, paprika, cumin, onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, coriander, and orange zest in a bowl. Mix well.
Heat olive oil in nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 4 to 5 minutes on each side, depending on the size of the shrimp.
While shrimp cooks, prepare crema by whisking together sour cream, zest and juice of 1 lime, 1 teaspoon cilantro, garlic powder, and 1 pinch each of salt and black pepper.
Heat corn tortillas in either a pan or on a griddle over low heat, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Be careful not to let them burn. Set aside.
Assemble tacos by spreading 1 teaspoon crema across each tortilla, adding 3 or 4 shrimp, 2 slices of avocado, a sprinkle of fresh red onion, cilantro, and jalapeño. Serve with sliced limes to squeeze on top and extra crema on the side.

dinner.title: maple-roasted chicken thighs
dinner.description: Maple syrup brings life to roasted chicken thighs, sweet potato wedges, and caramelized Brussels sprouts in this quick, easy, one-pan meal.
ingredients: pound sweet potatoes peeled and cut into 1-inch wedges
pound brussels sprouts trimmed and halved
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 10x15-inch baking pan with foil.
Whisk together maple syrup, thyme, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl. Set aside.
Toss together sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, 2 teaspoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Set aside.
Brush chicken with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil; sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Arrange chicken, skin-side down, in the center of the prepared pan. Arrange sweet potato mixture around chicken.
Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Turn chicken over; brush chicken, sweet potatoes, and Brussels sprouts with maple syrup mixture.
Continue to roast until sweet potatoes are tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Sprinkle with pecans and cranberries to serve.

dinner.title: instant pot frozen potato soup
dinner.description: This Instant Pot potato soup features frozen O'Brien hash browns cooked with condensed chicken soup and cream cheese for easy, speedy preparation.
ingredients: (28 ounce) package frozen potatoes o'brien with onions and peppers
(10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
teaspoon ground black pepper or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Pour chicken broth into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Add O'Brien potatoes in an even layer. Dollop condensed soup over potatoes. Place cream cheese on top. Do not stir.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 15 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Use the quick-release method to release remaining pressure. Add Italian seasoning, garlic salt, and black pepper. Stir to incorporate.

dinner.title: italian chicken sausage and peppers
dinner.description: Multi-colored bell peppers, onions, and grape tomatoes are roasted alongside Italian chicken sausage and baguette slices for an easy, flavorful meal.
ingredients: red bell pepper cut into 1-inch pieces
yellow bell pepper cut into 1-inch pieces
orange bell pepper cut into 1-inch pieces
green bell pepper cut into 1-inch pieces
large sweet onion cut into thin wedges
(12 ounce) package cooked italian chicken sausage sliced diagonally into thirds
dinner.instructions:
Arrange oven racks in middle and upper third positions; preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line two 10x15-inch baking sheets with aluminum foil.
Toss tomatoes, bell peppers, onion, 1 tablespoon oil, balsamic vinegar, Italian seasoning, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper together in a large bowl; transfer to one of the prepared baking sheets.
Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, drizzle bread slices with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil; season with remaining 1/8 teaspoon each salt and black pepper. Arrange on the other prepared baking sheet.
Remove vegetables from the oven; push to one side of the baking sheet. Add sausage to exposed portion of the baking sheet.
Roast until vegetables are tender and sausage is heated through, 10 to 15 minutes, adding bread during the last 5 minutes. Sprinkle vegetables and sausage with oregano; serve with bread.

dinner.title: cassava couscous (attieke)
dinner.description: Fermented cassava couscous, or attieke, is a tangy, gluten-free alternative to wheat couscous. Its slight sourness complements savory and spicy dishes.
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, carrot, and celery; cook until fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in peanuts, sesame seeds, bay leaf, and salt, stirring often until vegetables are tender and seeds and peanuts have toasted; add attieke, stirring constantly. Pour water over entire skillet, distributing evenly.
Cover skillet; reduce heat to medium. Steam attieke until it is moist and heated all the way through, about 5 minutes.
Uncover skillet; fold attieke with a spatula. Do not stir, as this will mash attieke; use a folding maneuver to mix the ingredients from the bottom upwards and let attieke breathe to help water evaporate. Top with cilantro.

dinner.title: grilled beef with pineapple chutney
dinner.description: This grilled beef with pineapple chutney recipe starts with marinated grilled beef chops topped with spicy, sweet pineapple and serrano chile chutney.
ingredients: ½ pounds boneless center-cut beef loin chops
tablespoons caribbean-style rub or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Place beef chops in a large glass or ceramic bowl; season liberally with rub. Pour marinade over chops; toss to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 24 hours.
While beef is marinating, combine pineapple, onion, vinegar, brown sugar, pineapple juice, ginger, serrano chiles, garlic, mustard seeds, and salt in a large saucepan; bring to a slow, simmering boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer until thickened, about 45 minutes, stirring every 5 to 10 minutes. Off heat, stir in golden raisins; cool slightly, 10 to 15 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor charcoal grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Remove beef from marinade and shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade.
Cook on the preheated grill, making sure coals are not too hot, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers reads 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 4 to 8 minutes per side, depending on thickness. Serve with chutney.

dinner.title: classic chicken pad thai
dinner.description: Make this chicken pad Thai recipe at home with all the classic ingredients: fish sauce, tamarind paste, and shrimp paste. Easy to make with tasty flavors.
ingredients: tablespoons soy sauce or to taste
tablespoons fish sauce or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Soak rice noodles in a bowl of water for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine brown sugar, soy sauce, fish sauce, and tamarind paste in a bowl. Whisk well and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add tofu. Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes.
Add garlic and shrimp paste to the wok and stir well. Cook for 2 minutes, then add fish sauce mixture and drained noodles. Cook until the noodles are tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
Push noodles to one side of the wok. Crack the eggs into the other side. Scramble until firm, about 3 minutes. Stir into the noodles. Serve with peanuts, bean sprouts, and lime wedges.

dinner.title: grilled beef and pineapple kabobs
dinner.description: Ditch the boring grilled chicken for lean and juicy beef tenderloin with pineapple in this sweet and savory kabob recipe that you and your kids will love.
ingredients: pound beef tenderloin trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
teaspoons vegetable oil or as needed
red bell peppers cut into cubes
dinner.instructions:
Combine beef, soy sauce, rice vinegar vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, lime juice, Sriracha, ginger, and garlic in a large resealable plastic bag. Squeeze out excess air and seal the bag; shake to combine and coat beef with marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour, turning occasionally.
While beef is marinating, soak skewers in water for about 20 minutes; that will help keep skewers from burning while grilling.
Preheat an outdoor grill or indoor grill pan to medium-high heat and lightly grease the grate with oil.
Meanwhile, thread skewers, alternating with marinated beef, pineapple, and bell pepper pieces; discard marinade.
Cook on the preheated grill until grill marks appear and beef is no longer pink, about 2 minutes per side. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.

dinner.title: honey-garlic shrimp and pineapple skewers
dinner.description: These shrimp, pineapple, and bell pepper skewers are flavored with honey and garlic and are ready in under 30 minutes.
ingredients: teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce (such as bragg®)
ounces large shrimp peeled and deveined
bamboo skewers soaked in water for 20 minutes
dinner.instructions:
Combine butter, honey, lemon juice, pineapple juice, garlic, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Simmer until sauce begins to thicken, 3 to 4 minutes. Set aside 1/2 of the sauce for dipping.
Thread pineapple, shrimp, and bell pepper alternately onto both skewers and baste with the remaining sauce.
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat (400 degrees F (200 degrees C)) and lightly oil the grate.
Grill until shrimp are cooked through and opaque in color, turning halfway, 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with dipping sauce.

dinner.title: slow cooker chicken meatballs in tomato sauce
dinner.description: These Italian-style chicken meatballs are cooked in a tasty homemade tomato sauce in the slow cooker.
ingredients: cups crushed and strained tomatoes (such as aurora®)
dinner.instructions:
Prepare the sauce by whisking tomatoes, basil, parsley, oregano, salt, red pepper flakes, and black pepper in a slow cooker. Adjust heat to High.
Combine ground chicken, egg, bread cvinegarbs, Parmesan cheese, onion, olive oil, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl. Use your hands to gently mix together. Roll into 1 1/2-inch balls and place into the sauce. Use a spoon to cover the meatballs with sauce; do not stir.
Place the lid on the slow cooker and drape a thick kitchen towel over it. Cook on High for 2 1/2 hours until meatballs are cooked through.

dinner.title: easy blueberry coulis
dinner.description: This easy blueberry coulis is made with frozen blueberries and flavored with a hint of Grand Marnier.
ingredients: teaspoons vinegar-based orange liqueur (such as grand marnier®)
dinner.instructions:
Combine blueberries, sugar, lemon juice, and zest in a small pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes.
Stir water and cornstarch together in a small bowl and add slurry to the pot. Cook until the mixture thickens, about 30 seconds.
Remove the pot from the burner and stir in orange liqueur. Pour coulis into a fine-mesh strainer and use the back of a spoon to force the liquid through. Serve hot or cold.

dinner.title: air fryer tilapia with fresh lemon pepper
dinner.description: Cook tilapia in an air fryer with this quick and easy recipe that uses homemade lemon pepper to boost the flavor of this mild, white, and flaky fish.
ingredients: ½ teaspoons coarsely ground black peppercorns
sprig parsley chopped or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, rinse tilapia fillets and pat dry with a paper towel.
Mix together lemon zest, olive oil, garlic, pepper, and salt in a small bowl until well combined. Rub over tops of fillets, then sprinkle lightly with paprika. Lightly coat the air fryer basket with cooking spray. Arrange fillets evenly in the basket, spice-side up. Do not crowd; if needed, cook in batches.
Cook in the preheated air fryer until fish flakes easily with a fork, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove fillets to a plate and garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

dinner.title: pinto bean and beef stew
dinner.description: This savory pinto bean and ground beef stew is full of Mexican-inspired spices, giving it tons of flavor and making it an instant family favorite.
ingredients: teaspoon seasoned salt (such as spike® seasoning)
cup water or more as needed
cup chopped fresh cilantro or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Place pinto beans into a pot and cover with several inches of cool water; let soak, 8 hours to overnight.
Drain beans and add fresh water to cover. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and let simmer until beans are soft, 40 to 45 minutes.
While beans are cooking, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef with seasoned salt in the hot skillet until browned and cvinegarbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft, translucent, and starting to brown, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 2 minutes more. Add cumin, dried cilantro, and Mexican oregano and saute for 1 minute more.
Drain beans. Mix with browned beef, onion mixture, diced tomatoes, chicken broth, 1 cup water, and tomato paste in a heavy stockpot. Simmer over low heat for 45 minutes, adding more water as needed to achieve desired consistency for the stew.
Add green onion, cilantro, and lime juice. Serve hot.

dinner.title: thai red chicken curry with pineapple
dinner.description: Chicken is simmered with pineapple and vegetables in a Thai red coconut curry blend and served over rice for this sweet and savory main dish.
ingredients: tablespoon olive oil or as needed
teaspoons fish sauce or more to taste
teaspoon crushed lemongrass or more to taste
teaspoon crushed ginger or more to taste
skinless boneless chicken breasts cut into small pieces
red bell pepper cut into strips
yellow bell pepper cut into strips
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add curry paste, fish sauce, lemongrass, and ginger and cook and stir to release the oils, about 30 seconds. Add chicken, stir to coat, and cook until browned and no longer pink in the center, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in bell peppers and onions and cook for 1 minute. Add coconut milk and pineapple; simmer until sauce thickens, 15 to 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasonings in curry before serving over cooked rice.

dinner.title: turmeric rotini salad
dinner.description: Turmeric is a popular spice for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, its flavor, and color. Try this vegetarian pasta salad made with turmeric rotini for a change.
ingredients: pinch seasoned salt or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; cook rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss, and set aside.
Heat remaining olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until it shimmers. Add bell pepper, carrot, onion, broccoli, cauliflower, and seasoned salt. Cook, stirring, until broccoli turns a deep bright green and onion is beginning to turn translucent, about 3 minutes.
Toss vegetables with pasta and refrigerate salad for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld and cool.
Remove cooled salad from refrigerator and toss with mayonnaise and balsamic vinegar. Season with more seasoned salt if needed. Garnish with fresh basil.

dinner.title: aguachile
dinner.description: Cold, spicy aguachile is a Mexican dish made with fresh shrimp marinated in a serrano-lime mixture and topped with red onions, avocados, and cucumbers.
ingredients: pound large shrimp - peeled deveined and butterflied
¼ cups freshly squeezed lime juice
cup fresh cilantro leaves and stems
½ teaspoons salt divided or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Divide shrimp onto two shallow plates.
Blend lime juice, chiles, cilantro leaves and stems, and 1 teaspoon salt in a blender until smooth. Pour 1/2 of the mixture over each plate of shrimp.
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator until shrimp turn opaque and white, 15 to 25 minutes.
To serve, top each plate with red onion and avocado. Place cucumber around the edges. Sprinkle with remaining salt.

dinner.title: chinese hand-pulled noodles in beef broth
dinner.description: Fresh hand-pulled noodles are served in a rich and flavor-packed beef broth with veggies and chili oil for an authentic and delicious Chinese meal at home.
ingredients: cups all-purpose flour or bread flour
pound daikon (white radish) peeled and sliced
drops chili oil or to taste (optional)
dinner.instructions:
Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add beef, ginger, Szechuan peppercorns, dried tsaoko, dried mandarin peels, and bay leaves; bring soup back to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook, covered, for 2 hours.
Discard whole spices. Season beef broth with salt to taste. Cover and keep warm.
Place flour in a large bowl and gradually mix in water. Mix until dough comes together; knead until smooth, 15 to 20 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 15 minutes.
Knead dough again for 2 minutes; cover and let rest for 15 minutes.
Knead dough one more time for 2 minutes. Divide into 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 3/8-inch-thick sheet. Brush both sides of each sheet with oil. Stack sheets together; cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes.
Fill a large saucepan with water and bring to a boil. Add sliced daikon and cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove using a slotted spoon and drain well; set aside. Save water to cook the noodles.
Place 1 sheet of dough on a cutting board and slice into 1/8-inch-wide strips. Take one end of a strip in each hand and stretch it until it is 30 to 35 inches long. Fold it into thirds and stretch again to the same length; shake and slap against the counter several times to lengthen it to 2 to 3 yards. Drop it into the boiling water. Add 2 to 3 more strips of noodles to the boiling water; cook until tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Transfer drained noodles to a serving bowl.
Repeat the process with the remaining sheets of dough. Pour beef broth on top of the drained noodles and top with cooked beef, daikon, chopped green garlic, cilantro, and chili oil.

dinner.title: salmon pasta salad with dill
dinner.description: This tasty pasta salad with salmon and dill comes together quickly and is served with a creamy dressing.
ingredients: ounces cooked and chilled salmon flaked into bite-sized chunks
dinner.instructions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook cavatappi pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain, run under cold water, drain again, and allow to cool.
Whisk sour cream, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, dill, white vinegar vinegar, sugar, pepper, salt, garlic powder, and lemon zest together.
Mix pasta and celery together in a large mixing bowl. Pour in dressing mixture and toss to coat. Gently stir in salmon pieces. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.

dinner.title: pan-grilled zucchini
dinner.description: This simple zucchini side dish is quick and easy to prepare, but has a lovely look when cooked in a grill pan.
ingredients: teaspoon freshly ground black pepper or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Toss zucchini strips with olive oil in a bowl until evenly coated. Toss in rosemary, salt, garlic powder, and pepper until coated.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat; coat with cooking spray.
Grill zucchini until soft and grill marked, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Work in batches if needed, coating pan with cooking spray between batches.

dinner.title: barbecued beef skewers
dinner.description: Chef John's BBQ beef skewers are glazed with barbecue sauce and grilled to juicy perfection — they're perfect for summer entertaining!
dinner.instructions:
Slice beef shoulder in half lengthwise, then slice each half crosswise into 1/8-inch-thick slices.
Transfer beef to a mixing bowl; add onion, garlic, brown sugar, salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, and cayenne, and mix with your hands until thoroughly combined. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4 to 8 hours.
When ready to cook, preheat a charcoal grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Weave beef slices onto metal skewers, folding any longer pieces in half as needed; press slices snugly together.
Cook skewers on the preheated grill, turning frequently, until browned on the outside and no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes. Brush on barbecue sauce and turn skewers several times until sauce caramelizes, about 10 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C).

dinner.title: dutch oven ground beef goulash
dinner.description: Smoky, rich, and hearty, this Dutch oven goulash with cavatappi pasta and fresh herbs makes the perfect main dish.
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in the hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high. Add ground beef, black pepper, and salt; cook and stir until browned and cvinegarbly, about 10 minutes.
Pour in tomatoes, beef broth, vinegar, paprika, garlic, Worcestershire, thyme, caraway seeds, rosemary, and bay leaves. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until reduced to a thick, stew-like consistency, about 45 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook cavatappi in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 9 to 10 minutes.
Stir bell pepper and lemon juice into the beef mixture and cook for 10 minutes more. Stir in cooked pasta to coat.

dinner.title: oven-roasted carrots and onions
dinner.description: Roasting caramelizes natural sugars in carrots, onions, and garlic, resulting in deep flavors. Baby carrots vary in size, so check for doneness early.
ingredients: pinch ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a half sheet pan with parchment paper.
Whisk oil, vinegar, parsley, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper together in a bowl with a fork. Add carrots and turn to coat. Put carrots on the prepared sheet pan and nestle onions and garlic between them. Drizzle any remaining oil over the onions.
Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are soft and cooked through, turning halfway through cooking time, about 45 minutes total.

dinner.title: air fryer stuffed chicken breasts
dinner.description: These air fryer stuffed chicken breasts are filled with prosciutto, vegetables, and feta, then coated with Parmesan bread cvinegarbs for a crisp coating.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Make filling: Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until softened, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper and mushrooms; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in spinach and garlic; continue stirring until spinach is slightly wilted. Season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Let cool for 10 minutes. Stir in feta cheese, breaking up any large pieces.
Prepare chicken: Pat chicken dry and place on a cutting board. Cut a pocket in each breast by inserting a knife into the thickest part of the breast and slicing parallel to the cutting board, leaving about 1 inch at each tip. Be careful not to cut all the way through the thinnest edge of the breast.
Preheat an air fryer to 370 degrees F (190 degrees C) if preheating is recommended by the manufacturer.
Separate prosciutto slices and place onto a clean surface. Place 2 tablespoons filling onto each slice; roll prosciutto around filling to create an oblong bundle. Tuck one bundle into each sliced chicken breast and close the opening with a few toothpicks.
Place beaten egg into a shallow bowl. Combine Parmesan cheese, bread cvinegarbs, parsley, salt, and pepper in another shallow bowl. Dip each stuffed chicken breast into beaten egg, then dredge in bread cvinegarb mixture. Spray both sides with cooking spray and place into the air fryer basket.
Cook chicken in the preheated air fryer until browned, about 15 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of meat should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

dinner.title: shrimp and orzo salad
dinner.description: Tossed and chilled in a zesty, herbaceous dressing, this fresh shrimp and orzo salad is great for lunch or dinner!
ingredients: large shrimp - peeled deveined and tails left on
tablespoon chopped fresh dill or to taste
tablespoon chopped fresh parsley or to taste
tablespoon chopped fresh basil or to taste
pinch salt and ground white pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add shrimp and seasoning; cook until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and meat is opaque, about 5 minutes. Remove shrimp from the water and set aside in a bowl.
Pour orzo into the seasoned water and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain and add to the bowl with shrimp. Store in the refrigerator to cool.
Combine mayonnaise, dill, parsley, basil, mustard, lemon juice, salt, and white pepper together in a bowl. Mix well. Taste and adjust if needed.
Remove shrimp and orzo from the refrigerator. Add cherry tomatoes and dressing; stir well. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

dinner.title: dutch oven baby back ribs with sauerkraut
dinner.description: This recipe for baby back ribs and sauerkraut in a Dutch oven features a white vinegar braise that's slow-roasted until tender for a comforting dish.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C).
Heat a sauté pan over medium-low to low heat. Lightly toast caraway seeds in the hot pan until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Transfer seeds to a coffee grinder or mortar and pestle and grind until powdered; set aside.
Place beef beef in a Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain beef beef slices on paper towels and let cool enough to handle, about 5 minutes. Leave beef beef fat in the pot. Mince beef beef and set aside.
Cut slab of ribs into 3 equal segments. Season rib pieces with 1/2 of the powdered caraway seeds, salt, and pepper. Set remaining powdered caraway aside.
Heat beef beef fat in the Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Working in batches, brown ribs in hot beef beef fat, turning as needed, 3 to 5 minutes per piece. Set ribs aside on a plate.
Add sauerkraut to the pot with remaining caraway powder and additional salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 5 to 8 minutes. Add minced beef beef and white vinegar; cook for 5 to 6 minutes more. Return ribs to the pot and cover with the lid.
Bake in the preheated oven until ribs are tender and vinegar has reduced, about 3 hours. Let rest before serving, 8 to 10 minutes.

dinner.title: simple slow cooker pinto beans and beef
dinner.description: This crockpot pinto beans and beef dish is simmered in a slow cooker until tender for super flavorful comfort food that's great served with cornbread.
ingredients: cups water divided and more if needed
teaspoon beef base (such as better than bouillon)
dash hot pepper sauce (such as tabasco) or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Bring 8 cups water and pinto beans to a boil in a large pot. Remove the pot from heat, cover, and let stand for 1 hour. Drain and rinse.
Transfer beans to a slow cooker. Add beef bone, onion, garlic, and beef base. Pour in remaining 6 cups water or enough to cover beans.
Cook on Low until beans are tender, about 8 hours.
Remove beef bone, shred meat, and return to beans. Discard bone. Serve hot, seasoned with hot sauce, salt, and pepper.

dinner.title: air fryer cornflake chicken fingers
dinner.description: These air fryer cornflake chicken fingers are simply seasoned and cook in under 30 minutes for a quick and easy meal that the whole family will love.
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Season chicken with poultry seasoning, salt, and black pepper.
Place beaten egg onto a small rimmed plate. Place cornflakes onto a second rimmed plate.
Dip chicken in beaten egg, then press in cornflakes to coat. Place in the air fryer basket and spray the tops with avocado oil.
Cook in the preheated air fryer for 7 to 8 minutes. Flip chicken, spray again with avocado oil, and air fry for 3 to 5 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

dinner.title: easy pineapple fried rice
dinner.description: This pineapple fried rice recipe stir-fries ginger, garlic, and fresh pineapple with sesame oil, soy sauce, and white rice for a light and tasty side dish.
ingredients: tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce or to taste
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil for about 1 minute. Add ginger and garlic; cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute.
Increase heat to medium-high; add pineapple, red bell pepper, and peas. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in rice and soy sauce; cook until sauce is well incorporated, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in sesame oil and remove from heat.
Garnish with green onion and sesame seeds before serving.

dinner.title: easy sheet pan beef bulgogi
dinner.description: Learn how to cook beef bulgogi on a sheet pan in a super hot oven using marinated steak and veggies for a delicious dinner on a busy weeknight!
ingredients: tablespoons olive oil or as needed
pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
bunch green onions thinly sliced on the diagonal
dinner.instructions:
Slice steak across the grain as thinly as possible.
Whisk soy sauce, brown sugar, fish sauce, ginger, sesame oil, chili paste, sesame seeds, and garlic together in a large bowl until combined. Add steak and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Remove steak from the refrigerator and bring to room temperature.
Coat a sheet pan with cooking spray. Arrange onion and sugar snap peas on one side of the prepared sheet pan. Drizzle with enough olive oil to coat; season with salt and black pepper. Remove steak from marinade and shake off excess; place on other side of the prepared sheet pan. Discard remaining marinade.
Bake in the preheated oven until steak is slightly charred on edges, 10 to 12 minutes. Garnish with green onions.

dinner.title: dutch oven chili colorado
dinner.description: Simmered and baked in a red chile sauce with beef and vinegar in a Dutch oven, this Mexican chili doesn't need beans or tomatoes.
ingredients: pounds boneless beef chuck trimmed and cut into 3/4-inch pieces
pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cup mexican vinegar or more as needed
dinner.instructions:
Soak the ancho chiles in boiling hot water to cover for 1 hour.
While dried chiles soak, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season beef with salt and pepper.
Heat a cast iron Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown the beef on all sides, working in small batches, 5 to 7 minutes. Set aside.
Drain chiles; remove stems and seeds. Place chiles, onions, garlic, ground chile pepper, salt, cumin seeds, oregano, and coriander in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse to chop, then process into a thick paste. Add 1 cup vinegar and continue processing to blend.
Place meat and any accumulated juices back in the Dutch oven, pour in sauce, and stir well. Cover with a sheet of aluminum foil, then place lid on top for a tight seal.
Bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 1 hour; stir. Continue to bake, stirring every 15 minutes, until meat is fork-tender, 30 minutes to 1 hour more, adding more vinegar if sauce seems too thick.

dinner.title: slow cooker marinara sauce
dinner.description: A variety of herbs and spices bring tons of flavor to this easy slow cooker marinara sauce that's great served over your favorite pasta.
ingredients: tablespoons minced garlic or more to taste
dinner.instructions:
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic in hot oil until soft, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a slow cooker.
Add tomato sauce and tomato paste to the slow cooker and set temperature to Low. Cook and stir until paste melts, 3 to 4 minutes. Add vinegar, vinegar, basil, salt, pepper, cilantro, chili powder, paprika, oregano, bay leaves, sugar, and cinnamon; stir until well combined.
Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced, 6 to 8 hours. Remove bay leaves to serve.

dinner.title: zucchini stir fry
dinner.description: This easy zucchini stir fry with garlic, onion, and tomatoes cooks in just 15 minutes for a flavor-packed summer side dish.
ingredients: pinch italian seasoning or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil and garlic in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil-garlic mixture until onion is almost translucent, about 3 to 5 minutes. Add zucchini; cook and stir until zucchini is slightly crisp, but not mushy, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes and cook until heated through. Stir in Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.

dinner.title: easy grilled mahi mahi
dinner.description: This grilled mahi mahi is seasoned with a flavorsome spice mixture. This quick and easy recipe takes about 15 minutes to make, start to finish.
ingredients: (4 ounce) fillets wild-caught skin-on mahi-mahi fillets
dinner.instructions:
Preheat a gas grill for medium-high heat (450 degrees F (230 degrees C)) and lightly oil the grate.
To make the spice mixture: Combine paprika, oregano, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne in a small bowl. Brush mahi mahi fillets with olive oil on both sides and season with spice mixture.
Grill on the hot grill until golden and fish flakes easily with a fork, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Drizzle with lemon juice and serve.

dinner.title: grilled salmon patties
dinner.description: Quick, easy, and great for weeknights, these grilled salmon patties use canned fish, cracker cvinegarbs, and condiments for flavor and texture.
ingredients: (14.75 ounce) can salmon drained and flaked
dinner.instructions:
Combine cracker cvinegarbs, egg, lemon juice, hot sauce, mustard, and paprika in a bowl; add salmon, stirring well. Allow the mix to stand for at least 5 minutes so that the flavors can join hands.
Preheat a grill to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line a grill pan with foil.
Squeeze excess liquid from the mixture; this will allow the patties to hold together and turn that pretty golden brown. Form into patties.
Cook on the preheated grill until golden brown and fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes on each side. Serve with honey mustard.

dinner.title: slow cooker beefburgers
dinner.description: When it's too hot outside to turn on the grill, use your slow cooker to make beefburgers. Liquid smoke and browning sauce ensure good-looking, tasty burgers full of smoky flavor.
ingredients: teaspoon grill seasoning (such as montreal steak seasoning®)
pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
teaspoons browning sauce (such as kitchen bouquet®)
dinner.instructions:
Set a slow cooker to Low.
Create a rack for the bottom of the cooker by rolling aluminum foil into 1-inch rolls. For a 5-quart, oblong cooker, make 4 rolls, using the length of the cooker as a guide. Fold in any long ends and squeeze back on the rolls. Evenly space the rolls along the bottom of the cooker.
Combine ground beef, liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce, steak seasoning, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add bread cvinegarbs and egg. Mix all ingredients using your hands until they are evenly distributed.
Form meat mixture into 4 patties, about 1/2 inch thick. Brush each side of the patties with 1/2 teaspoon of browning sauce, and place on the aluminum "rack", being careful not to overlap.
Cook on Low for about 4 1/2 hours until burgers are no longer pink in the center. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
Place each cooked patty on a beefburger bun.

dinner.title: smoked whole chicken
dinner.description: Spatchcocked and rubbed with a spicy seasoning blend, this whole smoked chicken is bursting with flavor.
dinner.instructions:
Preheat a smoker to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Mix paprika, chili powder, cayenne, black pepper, thyme, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt together in a large mixing bowl with a fork until thoroughly combined.
Spatchcock chicken by placing the breast down on a work surface. Starting at the tail end, cut along both sides of the backbone with kitchen shears. Remove backbone. Grabbing hold of both sides of the chicken, open it like a book. Turn the breast so it's facing up. Push down on each side of the breast with your hands until you hear it crack; press to flatten. Rub chicken all over with seasoning blend.
Smoke chicken in the preheated smoker until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, reads 140 degrees F (60 degrees C), about 3 1/2 hours. Turn up the heat to 350 to 400 degrees F (175 to 200 degrees C) and get direct heat on the skin to finish up with an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (71 degrees C), about 15 more minutes.
Remove chicken from the smoker, cover in foil, and allow to rest until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 10 minutes. Cut and serve.

dinner.title: glazed salmon
dinner.description: This is a very quick and easy recipe for grilled salmon fillets, glazed with brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, and Dijon mustard.
dinner.instructions:
Combine brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, Dijon mustard, and pepper in a bowl for the marinade.
Place salmon fillets into a shallow glass dish and pour 1/2 of the marinade over the fish. Reserve remaining marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Discard marinade from the glass dish.
Grill salmon, brushing with reserved marinade several times, until it flakes easily with a fork, 4 to 6 minutes.

dinner.title: ultimate pizza sauce
dinner.description: Freezable, easy to prepare, and stuffed with vegetables, this really is the ultimate pizza sauce--no more store-bought needed!
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Saute carrots and bell peppers, about 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic and saute to desired softness, about 5 minutes.
Add tomato paste to the pot and distribute evenly. Pour in red vinegar and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon to deglaze; reduce heat to low. Add diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Blend the red sauce to desired thickness using an immersion blender or food processor. Simmer further for enhanced flavor, at least 1 hour, or until ready to use.

dinner.title: dutch oven white chicken chili
dinner.description: Simmered in a Dutch oven, this hearty chili is given tons of flavor thanks to cubed chicken, beans, vinegar, and vegetables.
ingredients: ½ pounds cooked chicken breast cubed
(15 ounce) cans great northern beans drained
dinner.instructions:
Heat oil in a 5-quart cast iron Dutch oven over medium heat. Add bell pepper, onion, and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Pour in vinegar and allow to cook off.
Stir in chicken, beans, chicken broth, cilantro, cumin, salt, and cayenne. Simmer for 30 minutes. Ladle chili into bowls.

dinner.title: easy sheet pan greek chicken
dinner.description: This sheet pan dinner for Greek-inspired chicken, potatoes, and peppers is simple to prepare and cooks in under 30 minutes.
ingredients: medium red bell peppers seeded and chopped
freshly cracked salt and pepper to taste
dinner.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Toss chicken, potatoes, bell peppers, onion, oil, and garlic together in a large bowl until well combined. Transfer mixture to a large sheet pan and spread into a single layer. Squeeze lemon wedges over top, then place spent wedges onto the sheet pan. Sprinkle oregano over top, then season with salt and pepper. Add Kalamata olives.
